name: Coast Coal Harbour Hotel

reviews.text: As one of a party of six, I recently stayed at this hotel. Can't really praise it enough. Rooms were great, staff were always friendly and helpful, especially the concierge dept.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very enjoyable experience!
reviews.title: Great position

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in the middle of June and found the staff very friendly and helpful. The room was fine and the position of the hotel is excellent, being very near the bus stops for the tourist buses around the city. We didn't eat in the hotel, but had breakfast in one of the coffee shops behind.
reviews.title: Convenient, Comfortable, and Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We (two adults) stayed here in late May for two nights prior to a cruise to Alaska. The hotel is very modern, but still retains a warm feeling. The Front Desk staff were wonderful. They checked their system and found a room available that had a small view of the water from the corner window for us at no additional charge. I really enjoyed that sliver of water during our stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located to most attractions, shops, restaurants in the downtown area. We walked to most places. It is almost across the street from Urban Fare, a grocery store that also serves meals if you want a quick breakfast or lunch.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, more reasonably priced than others

reviews.text: We got a great deal at hotwire for this hotel for several nights of stay. However, after our purchase, we noticed that the Coal Coast hotel already gave its own deal if you stayed for several nights which you could book directly through their website. We did not realize until after booking with hotwire that there was only valet parking at about $35 per day. The location is excellent, within walking distance to many attractions. The room was excellent -- everything clean and in great condition. The only thing I did not like were the designer cushions that lay on each bed/chair. I wondered how they could be kept clean and they seemed worn out a bit. Didn't think there was any need for them. They should have provided extra pillows instead if they wanted more comfort for sitting. The maid service was excellent. We used the gym and hotel pool and they were very nice as well. The room did not have a fridge or microwave had and little counter space for a family to eat something in the room if necessary. It was not very spacious but the bathroom was definitely adequate in size. (Maybe it was the room we got.) However, the view from the room was beautiful. We used the business center which was always quiet and had a larger feel than other hotel business centers. The hotel had bathroom facilities in the lower floor accessible by escalator from the lobby so you could freshen up quickly if you were at a lower floor and didn't want to go all the way back to the room.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made a last-minute reservation at this hotel through Hotel Tonight, and we really were lucky! The rate was very reasonable, but I understand that they do not have rooms available on that app very often. The staff was so helpful - they printed out directions to a number of restaurants, brought them up to the room, and didn't accept an offered tip! The room was very clean, and the lobby was comfortable and inviting. Parking was a breeze, and when we requested extra time to leave our car in their garage, they didn't charge anything additional. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great staff, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in June. We arrived a little early from our 10.5 hour flight but the receptionist still let us check in early, which I was very happy about. We were in the 14th floor, we sadly couldn't see the water from our room but could see the mountains which was nice. Our room was spacious and very clean. The beds were very comfy and we slept very well. The location is really good. You can walk to most places including Canada Place, Stanley Park and the Waterfront Station. Overall couldn't fault anything really.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a great location

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay again.
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable room!

reviews.text: Overall a great experience! The staff was great, room was comfortable (especially the beds!) and clean, and all in a great location. Close to the waterfront & Canada Place (where many of the tours started) as well as a quick walk to dining options. Would stay here again for sure!
reviews.title: Good convention hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Coast Coal for 1 night before our cruise and 3 nights after the cruise. The hotel is modern and clean. For the night before the cruise we had a room facing the office blocks but this did not worry us. After the cruise we had booked a superior king room and this was on the 12th floor with a view of the harbour between the buildings. Lovely! Checkin was smooth and the desk staff were very helpful. On the return from the cruise we left our bags at the front desk (it was 9.30am) and came back later to check in-no problem. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The beds and pillows were great! All staff were friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Time here and close to everything

reviews.text: In 2010, we stayed in Fairmont Pacific Rim and we encountered a typical big hotel problems - no rooms ready after the check-in time, and a concierge with a major attutude. The room and the other staff including the engineer staff were great but there was no personal feel that you get in a smaller boutique hotels. So this time, I decided to try this new green hotel. What a great hotel and the staff!!! Each staff was great, but especially Jeremiah at the front desk. He took a time to explain about the sight seeing spots for us in details. When we told him that we were not interested in a tour, he told us the way to see two attractions using the free shuttles and a public bus.
reviews.title: I will be back again and again!

reviews.text: Sometimes hotels uses "being green" as an excuse for lack of comfort etc. but not this hotel. It is very clean, and very comfortable, and very GREEN. The shampoo and shower jell were in the large bottles, and there were three garbage baskets - one for garbage, one for recycle, and one for compost. Now one for compost really impressed me! How many times have I regretfully thrown a banana peel into a trash! Here I did not have to!
reviews.title: This brand new hotel is very good

reviews.text: This will be going to my choice hotel in Vancouver!!
reviews.title: Everything was perfect

reviews.text: Stayed here for two days. Enjoyed the helpfull staff (left a photo camera in a cab, but the staff acted so quickly that we had it back in minutes, thanks again!!), spacious room with a ocean view and good beds , swimming pool, gym and free fast and reliable wireless internet. The hotel is close to the waterfront, Stanley park, shops and all other places that are of interest. We would certainly go back here.
reviews.title: centrally located in downtown Vancouver

reviews.text: We recently stayed in Vancouver's Coast Coal Harbour Hotel and it was definitely beyond our expectations! It was one of the our last minute decisions to book in a hotel within the city and boy, were we glad we did.The hotel was luxurious, centrally and conveniently located to the must-see attractions like Robson St and Robson Square. Olympic Park, Stanley Seawall, Convention Center, etc. Very reasonably priced. Despite of it being a business hotel, it had a cozy feel of it being great for families as well. We were fortunately billeted at a corner room w/ good views of the harbor and the staff was most hospitable and helpful in more ways than one! Wanted to give special mention to Mr. Romy Herrera, the hotel comptroller who was quite welcoming and accomodating! Gave us a good insight on Vancouver and the highlights to see as seen by a local. Also, the people at the Front Desk and 2 concierge personnel named Ken, (i think) who was doing our valet parking for us. Always ready to give us personalized suggestions as how we made the most of our 3 day-2 night stay in the city. Amazing how in that span of time, we were able to do a quick bike ride along Stanley Park Seawall, have a quick visit to the beaches, go to Capilano Suspension Bridge, Kitsilano Beach and the Granville Islands and sample the best seafood a harbour city like Vancouver can offer. The hotel restaurant/bar was likewise an outlet to try. The food was exemplary and quite decently priced, with impressive service staff. If one is travelling on business, one can easily unwind in the very clean and well maintained gym, hot tub and pool. All in all, a great hotel to stay in. So, if you are looking for a hotel with the luxury feel to it, w/ personalized service and yet have that homey feel which a family can likewise enjoy, be it on business or pleasure, this is the hotel we totally suggest you look into! Thank you again, Romy and staff for a most wonderful stay!
reviews.title: A memorable stay - we will be back

reviews.text: Accompanied spouse on business trip with kids. Pleasantly surprised on how well the staff were so cool and nice with kiddos. Pool was not big but perfect for an afternoon swim. Rooms were clean and well kept. Close to attractions as well as convention center. Nice mix.
reviews.title: Business meet family friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night before we embarked on a cruise out of Vancouver and it was a great experience! When we checked in, the front desk clerk went above and beyond to make sure we had an excellent stay. The views from the hotel are beautiful (ours was a water view). The hotel was also very conscious about the environment which I liked. They had trash cans separated out for recycling as well as other eco-friendly additions. Our room was clean, stylish, and had every modern desire including free wireless internet and a clock radio with an iPod plug in. The price was also very reasonable when compared with other hotels in the area.
reviews.title: One of the best hotel experiences!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't say too much about this hotel as we arrived late at night from the airport, but service was polite and efficient. The taxi from the airport to downtown Vancouver costs between 30-40 Canadian dollars, but you can take the very good train link which actually takes the same amount of time and is only a few dollars.
reviews.title: A really good hotel in the heart of Vancouver

reviews.text: The bed was large and extremely comfy and the linen and pillows beautiful. The room was large and well apppointed as was the bathroom with everything you need including a set of scales. Very handy for weighing luggage on the return journey.
reviews.title: Great spot to end our BC tour

reviews.text: Part of a package tour, this hotel was perfectly located for the harbour, Stanley Park, Gas Town and lots to do! Rooms were a good size and nicely furnished - down side was that on the 8th floor there was still quite a lot of street noise, especially in the early morning. Minor niggles shared by fellow travellers was having to ask for tea, spoons etc to be replenished, the tv not working 24 hours after some sort of upgrade and rather keen chamber maids wanting to clean our room before we'd checked out. But not enough to put me off - would stay again.
reviews.title: Would stay again..

reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights in late June. I have very high standards, and couldn't have found a better hotel. The hotel is literally spotless, including the elevators and hallways, and its in an area that is very clean and safe. I came to Vancouver for nature and nightlife, and this hotel was perfectly situated for that, 4 blocks from Granville, and a 10 min bus ride from Stanley Park. I stayed on Granville the first 2 nights of my stay, which was fun, but not half as tranquil as the neighborhood that this hotel is located in. From check-in on, the staff treated me great the whole time I was there. The pool and hot tub were great, the gym was also really nice as well. Great organic market across the street, a 7/11 is in the building complex, and the bus stop to Stanley park is right across the street. Also a block from a handful of nice lunch restaurants/coffee shops up on Bute Street, and a block from a nice restaurant called the Mill Marine on Coal Harbour. The room was clean, the the bed was comfortable. I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Literally Impeccable Hotel

reviews.text: Great hotel option close to convention. The staff were very friendly and provided fantastic service. I was attending a conference at the Westin but it was sold out, but I am glad I stayed here instead, free wifi, and excellent amenities.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights as part of our trip around Canada.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in vancouver

reviews.text: At the time of booking we had mentioned that it was our wedding anniversary and requested a nice room for our stay. Upon arrival we were given a complimentary upgrade to 1 of the top level rooms (910) which had full length glass windows on both sides with absolutely amazing views over the harbour.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel had to be one of the friendliest and helpful hotels I have ever stayed in. The reception staff just couldn't do enough to help us enjoy our stay. We were given some great information and advice on which places to visit from personal experiences, and they certainly did get our approval. Jeramiah was a real gem, I bonded with him immediately; he gave us the thumbs up on Granville Island, which turned out to be just like a bohemian oasis in a sea of high rise buildings, wonderful, comfortable and well worth a visit.
reviews.title: We had a fantastic stay and would definately go back again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent many a lovely evening in Prestons restaurant in the hotel, and we were surprised and pleased to see that they had Vindaloo curry on the menu.
reviews.title: So modern and sleek, and the bed! Heaven.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definately recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent service, location and standard. What more could you ask for?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a night before leaving on a cruise. Wish we could have stayed longer. That bed was the perfect antidote for our east coast jet lag. Loved the blues and whites of the decor. Didn't get the chance to try out the pool or the amenities. The location was great for an early morning jog to Stanley Park. Hotel staff was very nice and helpful for recommendations of where to eat. Would stay here again if I return to Vancouver.
reviews.title: Sleek and eco-friendly

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in June 2011. We had a lot to pack in to our stay so we really appreciated the helpful front desk staff who ensured our room was available and organised tickets for the complimentary bus to the Capilano Suspension Bridge that was due to depart just 45 minutes after our arrival at the hotel.
reviews.title: A great 5 night stay

reviews.text: Well located, this hotel offers excellet opportunities to visit Vancouver, Gastown, Stanley Park, Canada Place, shopping on Robson street and more. Rooms are comfortables and the personel is always there to help. Good to know : pool, jacuzzi, fitness room. A new park along the bay and besides the convention is a great place to take a walk.
reviews.title: Close to everthing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to stay in town as we were going to a concert and she got a deal thru some internet site. Our room was nice and fairly large - a mini fridge and microwave would have been nice (maybe available in other rooms). The staff was very attentive. Parking (Valet) was a tad expensive but probably the norm in the area.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room faced into the city but I would think rooms on the north side would get a partial view of the harbour & mountains. We could see the outdoor pool (approx 3rd floor) and it looked ok.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great - 1 block from the waterfront where you can walk to Stanley Park or the Convention Centre. It is about 3 blocks up to Robson Street and a couple blocks to the Burrard Skytrain Station which in our case was excellent for getting to & from Rogers Centre for the concert.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay.

reviews.text: We arrived early in the morning after a long flight before embarking on a cruise out of Vancouver and the staff went out of their way to ensure that our room was available before the normal check-in time which was greatly appreciated.
reviews.title: Good City Hotel

reviews.text: We arrived too early (noon) for check-in, however they allowed us to store our bags while we went out exploring the city. The room was quite nice and we had a bit of a water view in a corner room on the 12th floor. Beds were comfy and linens were quality. Check in and out process was quick and easy. Room was quiet and we didn't hear any neighbors coming or going. The personnel at the valet and lobby were always friendly and accomodating to our needs. The location is right across the street from the "Seawall" for great walking, bike riding, and people watching. Centrally located a couple blocks from Robson Street where there are lots of restaurants and shopping. About an 8 minute walk to Stanley Park. Two minute walk to the Seawall and more restaurant options. A nice market/cafe right across the street. Seven 11 located at the back entrance for Scotia bank ATM and/or easy purchases. A drug store located across the street. About 10 minute walk to the Skylink system that brings you to the Vancouver Airport for $4 a person one way. We didn't bring a car, so used the public trans system and have no complaints. It was easy to use and the hotel was within close range to everything we needed and everywhere we went. We used the pool a couple of times and no complaints. Nice fitness center with quality machines. I would definely stay here again. Vancouver is a beautiful international city that was a great vacation point.
reviews.title: Great Location and Service

reviews.text: Both times we have stayed at this hotel, we were impressed with the friendly staff and willingness to assist us with whatever needs we had. We genuinely felt that each staff member wanted us to enjoy our stay. This time, we left clothes in the dresser and didn't realize it until we were back in the states. We called housekeeping who were very willing to help with our plight. Traditionally, they ship things to guests via postal service. We asked that they ship Fed Ex using our own account number. I could tell this was not something that had been asked of the head of housekeeping before, but she was extremely willing to ship it "our way" and got the necessary information and was only too glad to accommodate our request. When traveling, there are always inherent problems, delays, and mishaps, so when you stay at a hotel where the staff is genuinely trying to make things easier for you, it really makes a difference. We can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Exceptional Customer Service

reviews.text: Recently my sister and I stayed at the Coast Coal Harbour from July 9-19 while visiting my son. We arrived and were asked about our trip up to this point( which had been a nightmare). They upgraded our room for us and our check in was handled so effortlessly. Each time that we entered the lobby, it didn't matter who was at the front desk, they acknowledged us and asked how our day was. My son rode his bike to visit us and the concierge graciously checked it for him. One night my sister noticed a spot on her comforter and called guest services. The manager called us immediately with an apology and housekeeping was there in about 3 min. While he was changing the duvet cover there was another knock at the door and the manager had sent up a bottle of wine with a written apology. We were blown away.The staff here should give other hotels lessons in customer service as it has become a lost art. I plan on visiting again in the near future and will definitely make the Coast Coal Harbour my home base. Congratulations on a wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Best customer service EVER!

reviews.text: We arrived the afternoon of the 26th of June for the Kiwanis International convention and were greeted by very friendly and helpful staff. She even got a map out and showed us a number of sites,restaurants and shops close by.Our sister who lives in Vancouver spent the 1st nite with us and was brought in a cot (which was actually a real bed all made up) at the time we requested! We had a corner room with a beautiful view of the water between the surrounding tall buildings, a surprise and thrill for all of us! The bed was super comfy and the bathroom had a lovely deep soaker tub and bath products that were absolutely amazing.My sister and I both have very sensitive skin AND NO REACTIONS!!!!The maids also were fantastic and when we asked for more coffee for the in room coffee maker gave us 2 extra, yay! Oh 1 more cool thing the bathroom had a timed heat lamp which I turned on for extra light while putting on my makeup. The only negative was the small closet, so we just didn't unpack. Would stay again for sure!
reviews.title: Coast Coal Harbour Beautiful Hotel,Awesome Staff & Great Location!

reviews.text: We and another couple booked two rooms from one of the consolidator sites that "hides" the hotel's identity until you have booked. We wanted a 4* and took a chance. Good choice - great prices for a Fri-Mon weekend. The front desk upgraded us to view rooms and all went well. We did not eat at their restaurant, but it looked fine. There are many, many places in the neighborhood for dining and libations, and all of DT Vancouver is readily available by walking. And, the hotel is located only 2 blocks from the Skytrain station for the airport connection. The rooms are smartly decorated and well-appointed. The bathroom was large and robes were provided. The only possible downside was the parking fee - high by Seattle standards, but relatively reasonable by VCVR standards. We would book again. Nice lodgings, indeed.
reviews.title: Sleek, Efficient, Comfortable

description: Welcoming and spacious, the Coast Coal Harbour Hotel combines city sophistication with West Coast comfort. It's fresh, it's modern, and it has Vancouver at its doorstep with the best of everything the city has to offer. Places like Stanley Park, Gastown, the Vancouver Art Gallery, Vancouver Convention Centre and the shopping district of Robson Street. The Coast Coal Harbour Hotel is an urban retreat in downtown Vancouver. With 20 storey's boasting 220 modern, spacious guest rooms and all the amenities you've come to expect from Coast Hotels. A 5,000 square foot ballroom and conference centre includes 20-foot-high north-facing windows accented by coloured glass, creating a bright and airy environment. Private boardrooms, business centre, fully equipped gym with locker room, and a landscaped roof deck with an outdoor lap pool and hot tub have been designed with your comfort in mind. We encourage you to come visit one of the newest hotels in downtown Vancouver. And to enjoy the best that our city has to offer!
